intro: Psychotria cupulata, commonly known as the "cupula" or "cupula plant," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Psychotria cupulata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
